actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 107-645.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 393.
Mr. Duncan moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5169.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment

official_title: To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to enhance the security of wastewater treatment works.
short_title: Wastewater Treatment Works Security Act of 2002
subjects: Federal aid to water pollution control

summary.text: Wastewater Treatment Works Security Act of 2002 - Amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to authorize the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to make grants to a State, municipality, or intermunicipal or interstate agency to conduct a vulnerability assessment of a publicly owned treatment works and implement security enhancements for such facilities upon completion of the assessment.Authorizes the Administrator to: (1) provide technical guidance and assistance to small publicly owned treatment works (those serving a population of fewer than 20,000 persons) on conducting vulnerability assessments and implementing security enhancements; and (2) make grants to a nonprofit organization to improve vulnerability self-assessment methodologies and tools for publicly owned treatment works, including those that are part of a combined wastewater treatment and water supply system.Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: Wastewater Treatment Works Security Act of 2002
Wastewater Treatment Works Security Act of 2002
To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to enhance the security of wastewater treatment works.
